headline.main: THE ARMY AT CHEAT MOUNTAIN.; TERRIBLE STORMS ON THE MOUNTAINS--GREAT SUFFERING OF THE MEN--A FOOLISH AND UNFORTUNATE "RECONNOISSANCE," ETC.

docs.lead_paragraph: I have seen many storms upon Cheat Mountain, but that with which we have been visited during the past few days, surpasses all, in fury. Ever since last Saturday night the elements seem to have been engaged in a deeply planned conspiracy to make our condition as miserable as possible, and the execution of the plans has been most admirable.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

docs.snippet: As I was strolling the other morning by the camp of the regulars, as I often do, to notice their perfect drill and accurate evolutions, I found a portion of them in a neighboring field practicing as skirmishers.

headline.main: OUR WASHINGTON CORRESPONDENCE.; The Drill of the Regulars--Gen. McClellan and his staff--Going to a Review in a Storm--Condition of Affairs Along the Lines, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: As I was strolling the other morning by the camp of the regulars, as I often do, to notice their perfect drill and accurate evolutions, I found a portion of them in a neighboring field practicing as skirmishers.

headline.main: WHO FIRST SUGGESTED AN ATTACK ON BEAUFORT?

docs.snippet: The steamship City of Manchester, from Liverpool on the 6th inst., via Queenstown 7th, passed this point at 5 o'clock yesterday (Saturday) evening. She was boarded by the news-yacht of the Associated Press, and the news dispatch obtained.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; The City of Manchester off Cape Race. The Intervention of France, England and Spain in Mexico. THE TRIPARTITE TREATY SIGNED IN LONDON. ANOTHER HINT OF ULTERIOR DESIGNS. Further Decline in Cotton--Breadstuffs Firm--Provisions Dull.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship City of Manchester, from Liverpool on the 6th inst., via Queenstown 7th, passed this point at 5 o'clock yesterday (Saturday) evening. She was boarded by the news-yacht of the Associated Press, and the news dispatch obtained.

headline.main: A REBEL LETTER FROM FORT WALKER.

docs.snippet: This morning a party, consisting of Secretaries SEWARD, CAMERON and SMITH, Assistant Secretaries SEWARD, SCOTT and SMITH, Gov. ANDREW, Col. RITCHIE, Gen. VAN VLEIT, Col. FORNEY, Mr. THAYER and other distinguished citizens, with several ladies, left...

headline.main: GENERAL NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; SECRETARY CHASE RETURNED. Secretary CHASE returned to the city to-day A PLEASANT PARTY. DEATH OF LIEUT. SNYDER. BURNING OF THE NORFOLK NAVY-YARD. NAVIGATION OF THE POTOMAC. THE CALIFORNIA PRISONERS. DECISIONS UNDER THE TARIFF LAW. INTERESTING AUCTION SALES. GOV. RANDALL IN TOWN. ACCIDENTALLY KILLED. GEN. DENVER GOING TO KANSAS. A DEARTH OF NEWS. GEN. SUMNER.

docs.lead_paragraph: This morning a party, consisting of Secretaries SEWARD, CAMERON and SMITH, Assistant Secretaries SEWARD, SCOTT and SMITH, Gov. ANDREW, Col. RITCHIE, Gen. VAN VLEIT, Col. FORNEY, Mr. THAYER and other distinguished citizens, with several ladies, left on a special train for Annapolis. Gov. HICKS and daughter and Gen. BURNSIDE met the party on their arrival, and a salute was fired in honor of the event by the Twentythird Massachusetts, at the Naval School.

headline.main: A MINISTERIAL VIEW OF THE MATTER.
